title: Kinetic energy - projectile before striking ground

content.question: Three objects, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, of the same mass are launched into the air and fall to the ground. Each object has the same speed just before it strikes the ground, however Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> lands with a final velocity that is <math alttext="37 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn><mtext>°</mtext></math> below the horizontal, Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> lands with a final velocity that is <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn><mtext>°</mtext></math> below the horizontal, and Object <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> lands with a final velocity that is <math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>53</mn><mtext>°</mtext></math> below the horizontal. Which of these objects, if any, had the greatest kinetic energy just before striking the ground?

choices.label: All three objects have the same kinetic energy

content.answer: All three objects have the same kinetic energy

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
